column4: I am setting up an ubuntu webser, however it is only accessible by people connected to my wifi, how do I change this
*webserver
on the wifi look for port forwarding options. add a port forward for port 80 to the local server
it will be on your routers "WAN" page
how do I get to that page?
go to a console and tup "ifconfig | grep inet"
you say I have to open port 8-0?
I finally connected to it
somehow i knew you would without me having to say any more :P
I meant my router page...
what do I do from the browser pagte
have a look around in the firewall/port forward section. may modems/routers/wifi devices put on same page some have there own page.
it wants me to choose a program I am doing it for
what program is it asking for. ?
http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/837/yeaj.png/
http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/837/yeaj.png/
thats not the right page. your need to "port forward"
how did you go finding those port forwarding options?
turn the modem upside down see if its printed on the sticker. if it is and not the right one do factory reset then reconfigure
I am still here for when I finally figure out my password
What is the ssh port?
